text: Keg @ moto-I. Cloudy pour. Fairly sweet nose. Coconut and pear juice. Cotton candy and sugar cookies. Flavor is very sweet. Mashed banana and apple. Sugary hot finish. Quite oily.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy pale yellow with no head. Aroma is smooth fruity, crisp rice and mild estery. Smooth fruity. Lingering and smooth finish.
On tap at the Uptown location.  Cloudier appearance is the differentiator here.
Pours a cloudy white. Aromas and flavours are fruity and sweet. Smooth drinking. This is another good one from Moto-i
Another great sake from moto-i. Lovely milky colour. A nice sweet vanilla aroma and taste. Very good.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Tap at moto-i. Hazy milky pour. Nose is rice, milk, maybe a little coconut. Taste is pear, melon, and rice. Nice.
Bottle @ moto-i. Hazy light yellow appearance. Sweet light citrusy rice vinous nose. Light apple, sweet citrusy vinous flavor. Quite enjoyable.

~2 oz pour on draft at the Sake Brewpub in Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Pour is hazed cloudy whitish and clear.  Really interesting looking in the glass.  Aroma is a bit of citrus, some soft lavender floral and the normal fermeted rice notes.  Taste is a combination of the lavender floral and bright hot rice alcohol.  Though only mildly more alocoholic than the ginjo this really tasted a lot hotter.  Palate is medium bodied, a bit rougher which actually worked nicely with the taste profile.  Different, also nice.

On tap at the brewpub on 05/31/2009. Somewhat cloudy white body with no head and no legs. Light fruity rice aroma with some vanilla. Light fruit and vanilla flavor with rice notes. Medium light body with no carbonation.

Sampler @ the Sake brewhouse.  I have never had a Nigori before and was very surprised to see how cloudy it was, like rice milk, well that gets extra points for appearance.  Aroma is like a sweet pea pod mixed with dry grass, and a very strong berry aroma.  I was shocked how strong the aroma was for a sake, still struggling to understand what the standard is supposed to be.  Taste has a very apparent alcohol bite with sweet berries and a left over heat at the end from the alcohol. I can actually feel the murky unfiltered specs on my tongue, gives it a bit more substance, so I liked that.  I recommend this over the other house taps for a different kind of Sake experience.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: At the brewpub.  Thick and opaque, like milk.  There are little pieces of ground rice, and lots of them.  The best palate I have ever had on a sake.  Dry aroma, but medium sweet flavor, some fruit, and mild alcohol.  Very drinkable.

On draught at the sake brewhouse in uptown, Minneapolis, MN. Pours a cloudy chalky off-white sake with minimal tears and off-white disk top. Aroma is very faint but has a light pear and koji scent that can be challenging to pick up. Taste has a more  powdered rice and mild pear flavor that quickly disappears. Finish has a mild white pepper, a touch of honeydew with a quickly disappearing semi-dry aftertaste. Lighter in flavor and texture than most other nigori sakes Iâ€™ve tried but a nice refreshing unfiltered sake over all.
Solid cloudy appearance.  Increasing aroma of koji mold.  Floral aroma with hints of honeydew.  Very very smooth appearance.
Cloudy white appearance, kind of like watered down milk.  Very light aroma of mold.  Light rice taste.  Big floral, orchid-like taste.  Solid honeydew.  Incredibly smooth and silky feel.  Impressed!
